List¶

harrison_functions.utils.std.list.chunker(array, num_elem=2)¶
Group array elements into chunks for iteration
>>> chunker([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], 4)
[[1, 2, 3, 4], [5, 6]]

harrison_functions.utils.std.list.create_intervals(start, stop, num_intervals=2)¶
Create evenly spaced intervals
>>> create_intervals(0, 10, 5)
[[0, 2], [2, 4], [4, 6], [6, 8], [8, 10]]

harrison_functions.utils.std.list.move_list_item_to_end(input_list: list, item)¶
>>> move_list_item_to_end([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 3)
[1, 2, 4, 5, 3]

harrison_functions.utils.std.list.pairwise(iterable)¶
See: https://docs.python.org/3/library/itertools.html#recipes
s -> (s0,s1), (s1,s2), (s2, s3), …

harrison_functions.utils.std.list.renumerate(sequence)¶

reverse enumerate


harrison_functions.utils.std.list.peek(stack)¶
